send_email.email_subject: You have no boundaries with Tech Skills
send_email.description:
{{first_name}}, you don't have boundaries with tech skills.

From web development to product design to app development and many more. 

And one news that I'm sure will excite you is that "there is no late comer in tech."

Even if you get interested at age 50, I can assure you there are a lot of resources that will help you get to your desired destination in the world of tech. 

There is space for everybody in the tech world, and you don't have to be a graduate of computer science to learn tech skills. 

Though the world of tech is a vast field, there are different skills in the world of tech.

Let me do a quick recap on two areas in the world of tech: 

### 1. Web development
Web development in simple English is the process of building and maintaining a website for the internet that is accessed through a web browser. 

As a web developer, your job is mainly to build websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. 

In web development there are two aspects of web development: 

- Front-end: This is the part of the web you see on the browser
- Back-end: This is the part of the website you don't see; it deals with a lot of the logic and functionality. Remember the restaurant description in the book? 

### 2. Mobile Development 
This is one of the last decade's most popular forms of coding. 

This is because you can't do without apps on your mobile phone. Imagine having a phone, and there are no apps on it?? 

Boring right?? 

Now you know why these skills are relevant. 

There are two main categories of mobile devices, which are: 
iOS
Android

Are you excited about the boundless opportunities hovering around tech?

If your answer is yes, let us discuss how you can begin a tech career in 12 weeks. [Pick a date and time here](https://instincthub.com/calls/30/).

{{first_name}}, web developers worldwide are solving problems, and job relevance is improving. 

A web developer's job is to create websites. Web developers always fall into one of these three categories: 

### 1. Front-end web developers: 
Think of these individuals as the people in charge of an eatery's open space. The customers can buy food and decide to eat there or request a takeaway. 

The front-end developers work on the visual part of the website - the pages people interact with. They design the layout of each page, integrate graphics, and use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to enhance the site's interactivity.

### 2. Back-end web developers: 
Think of these individuals as the people in charge of an eatery's kitchen. They do the behind-the-seen work to ensure the food is appealing, edible and delicious. 

Back-end developers make sure the users and business data are properly managed. They create structure and logic that communicate with the front-end and other third parties applications.

### 3. Full-stack developer: 
These individuals do the work of the chef in an eatery kitchen and that of the people in charge of the open space.

They do the work of both a back-end and front-end developer. These developers know and can implement all it takes to build an entire web application.  

Interestingly {{first_name}}, you could be one of these great individuals! 

Let us discuss how you can begin a tech career in 12 weeks. [Pick a date and time here.](https://instincthub.com/calls/30/)

{{first_name}},

As I said in one of my previous emails, mobile development is one of the most popular forms of coding and here are the two categories of mobile devices we have:

**iOS** is a mobile operating system developed and distributed by Apple Inc. It was initially released in 2007 with the iPhone and today runs on many other devices, including the iPod Touch, iPad, and Apple TV.

**Android** is an open-source, Linux-based mobile operating system. Android was developed by the Open Handset Alliance, led by Google and featured contributions from many other companies.

And there are many career opportunities in the mobile development world: 

- Java Application Developer
- Mobile Software Engineer 
- iOS Software Engineer

send_email.email_subject: Your children Vs economy, who wins?
send_email.description:
Parenting and trying to put food on the table isn't easy! 

I would understand if you haven't read the free eBook "What no school will ever teach your kid!"

As a parent, setting up a big fight between your children and the economy is not always the right thing to do; they will likely lose the fight because they are at the Marcy of the economy. 

Two young men grew up wanting to become doctors, so they went to a medical university and graduated with flying colours after eight years of intensive learning. 

But due to the economy, getting a job was another battle they had to fight, but not for one of them, his name was Philip, at the age of 7, Philip was enrolled on a coding class by his parents, and he worked and master that skill over the years until he becomes a pro.

Philip has been creating an Application for managing hospital records ever since JSS3. 

And when Philip finally graduated, he marketed this App and Software to all the hospitals in the country. Eventually, almost all the hospitals signed up for his App then income began to flow in. 

Not only was Philip making millions from his creation, but all the hospitals in the country and abroad also wanted to work with him because he wasn't like all the other doctors; he had something different to offer to the medical world. 

Thanks to Philip's parents!!!

So, as a parent, would you want to set a fight between your children and the economy, or would you want to make your child a winner before the war even starts?

Just like how Philip's parents did for him, would you also want your child to beat the economy and create something that would give him millions in his profession?

If yes, then lets chat on how you can get started with: 

* Skills that school would never teach your kids, 
* Morden skills that will make them future billionaires.
* Skills that would secure them brighter future.

send_email.email_subject: My daughter can't marry a poor man!

{{first_name}},

The richest man said his daughter can't marry a poor man.

If he, the richest man in the world, could accept that his daughter marries a poor or modest man. 

 

His answer can change something in everyone.

 

His response: First of all, understand that wealth does not mean having a fat bank account. Wealth is primarily the ability to create wealth.

 

Example: Someone who wins the lottery or gambling. Even if he wins 100 million is not a rich man: He is a poor man with a lot of money. That's the reason why 90% of the lottery millionaires become poor again after five years.

 

You also have rich people who have no money.

 

Example: Most entrepreneurs.

 

THEY are already on the road to wealth even though they have no money because they are developing their financial intelligence, and that is wealth.

send_email.email_subject: This data gives me sleepless nights
send_email.description:
{{first_name}}, I wish I don't have to go through this stress. 

 

Whenever I think about the unemployment in Nigeria and the global rate,  I get scared most of the time. 

 

According to the Nigeria Bureau of Statistics (NBS), 33.1% of Nigerians are unemployed. 

 

With over **200 million** population, **66.2 million** Nigerians are out of a job. 

 

Every year, Nigeria produces about **500,000** graduates to compete with the unavailable jobs.

 

These figures won't stop increasing until we start grooming our kids with the skills to create jobs rather than ending up seeking and begging for employment opportunities.  

 

What do you need to do?

 

Chat with us, and we will show you a stress-free strategy.

 

We will teach your child how to code in 12 weeks. 

 

Lets get you started with the process. [Schedule a free call now!](https://instincthub.com/calls/30/)

{{first_name}}, Recently, I read a story of a family that touched my heart. I wish every family always had the same end result. Mr Frank and his wife noticed that their kid's (Samuel) performance got worse in school, and they tried everything they could but didn't get any tangible result. Mr frank loves Samuel a lot, and he isn't satisfied with what is going on with his academics. Not quite long, Mr Frank and his wife came up with an idea to change Samuel's school, hoping that things would improve. Unfortunately, it was almost as if things had gotten worst. This continued for a while... Few years later, Samuel was able to graduate from the university with a fantastic turnaround grade. After some time, Samuel got an incredible job with a notable tech company. Really, {{first_name}}! The offer was a very outrageous take-home salary. Aside from the salary, Samuel was made the technical adviser of his unit; with this position, he will have to travel a lot to sensitise other people. In one of his presentations, his father paid a surprise visit to be one of the participants. Before Samuel finished his presentation on that very day, the audience stood on their feet to applaud Samuel for his stunning performance. A man afar off started shouting, "That's my son!" That's my son!!!" Who else could it be? That was Samuel's father (Mr Frank) with profound joy all over his face. ### Now, let us talk about the real thing! In the early days of Samuel's career, his father introduced him to coding class, which changed the whole world for him. With coding skills, Samuel was able to conquer his fears and solve complex problems. Seriously {{first_name}}, it is not about changing your kids school alone. It will make sense if your child start learning how to solve complex problem gradually as they grow. You, too, can become that visionary parent to your kids and give them a skill that no one can ever take away from them.
**_It is okay if you're too busy to monitor and guide them to get these skills, that's where we come in. We have some tips for you, {{first_name}}!_**
